instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittently Not Detecting SSD - Question Mark - Previous Liquid Damage
threads.message:
It turns on and works fine for a while, but often when it starts or awakes from a long-term not usage turns on with a question mark. Same when used for an extended period of time.

Previous liquid damage around <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>/5 doesn't seem to be related to SSD lines. Also, some around <RESISTOR>R3773</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U3700</CHIP> corner.

Tested with two good known SSDs, reinstalled still an intermittent issue. Cant measure with a board outside of the case when an issue occurs hence omitted some measurements.

J8600 - When Problem Occurs
4 - 0.24V
5 - 0.003V - <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_CONN_L</SIGNAL>
6 - 1.78V - <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_CONN_L</SIGNAL>
7 -
8 - 0V
9 - 3.4V
10 - 3.2V
11 -
12 -
13 - 3.2V

Looking at[URL='https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-hdd-problem.63074/'] @tipoti trouble[/URL] when it's working, measurements seem to be the same as mine when not working.

Cleaned the connector multiple times and inspected under a scope. No damage.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittently Not Detecting SSD - Question Mark - Previous Liquid Damage
threads.message:
If no changes on signal and control lines, then should be a communication problem on data lines.
You should test with external USB macOS and check if internal SSD is still detected in Disk Utility, but you can't access it to read/write.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittently Not Detecting SSD - Question Mark - Previous Liquid Damage
threads.message:
When I reboot usually comes online and works as expected. I can load from it, and it runs perfectly with no SSD errors.  Haven't seen it come with a question mark again after I shut down and rebooted from the previous question mark. It loads up straight away until the next time when it crashes and reboots to a question mark.

Just from time to time comes with a question mark and an error after a restart - your mac restarted because of a problem.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittently Not Detecting SSD - Question Mark - Previous Liquid Damage
threads.message: There should be some corroded contacts, traces, or data line components...
